content.text:
# Anwar Elahi

Anwar Elahi (1936 or 1937 â€“ 19 October 2016) was a Pakistani cricketer who played first-class cricket irregularly from 1953 to 1969.
In November 1953, while still at school, Elahi made his first-class debut for Sind in the first-ever match in the Quaid-e-Azam Trophy. He took 4 for 64 with his leg-spin, Sind's best bowling figures, in Bahawalpur's first innings. His brother Ikram Elahi top-scored for Sind with 63.
He worked as a businessman until his death from pneumonia in October 2016.
